title: How to Contact Narendra Modi and the Prime Minister of India's Office

steps.title: Send a letter to the Prime Minister’s Office in New Delhi.
steps.content: Send a letter to the Prime Minister’s Office in New Delhi. If you want to share your ideas, insights, thoughts, or grievances against the services of the government, you can write a letter to Prime Minister Modi. Be sure to put your letter in a properly stamped and self-addressed envelope, and send it to: [1] X Research source Prime Minister’s Office South Block, Raisina Hill New Delhi, 110011

steps.title: Be concise and include a return address to get a response.
steps.content: Be concise and include a return address to get a response. Keep your letter short so Prime Minister Modi isn’t overwhelmed by the length. Address him as Prime Minister Modi or PM Modi, then share your ideas, insights, thoughts, or grievances. Use concise language and split paragraphs up by double spacing them or leaving a line between them. Check your spelling and grammar before sending your letter. Make sure your handwriting is legible or type your letter on the computer. Put your address as a return address in the upper left-hand corner of the envelope. End your letter in a respectful and positive tone by saying, “Thank you for your time” or “Thank you for your consideration.”

steps.title: Use the correct amount of postage before sending the letter.
steps.content: Use the correct amount of postage before sending the letter. If you’re sending internationally, it costs around USD 1.65 to send a letter. Take the letter to your local post office, and they will be able to determine if the price is different in your area. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Dial your exit code and India’s country code if you call internationally.
steps.content: Dial your exit code and India’s country code if you call internationally. If you live in the United States, the exit code is “011,” but it will vary based on where you’re from. After the exit code is entered, dial “91” to connect to phone numbers in India. [3] X Research source Find your country’s exit code here . You do not need an exit code or country code if you live in India. Make sure you have an international plan before making your phone call since overseas calls are very expensive and could charge additional fees.

steps.title: Type in “11” for the area code.
steps.content: Type in “11” for the area code. Each area of India has a 2 to 4-digit area code, and “11” is the area code for Delhi. Dialing the international area code first will let your phone company know what country you’re calling. [4] X Research source If you’re already in the Delhi area, you do not need to add an area code.

steps.title: Enter “23012312” to finish the phone number.
steps.content: Enter “23012312” to finish the phone number. This line will take you directly to the Prime Minister’s Office. Wait as the call connects and starts to ring. [5] X Research source Since it is an international number, it may take a few moments to connect. If there has been no response after 1 minute, hang up and try dialing the number again.

steps.title: Leave a message with his office.
steps.content: Leave a message with his office. You may not get in contact with PM Modi directly, but you can relay information, ideas, or concerns to one of his staff members. Ask them to take a message and be polite throughout the whole conversation. [6] X Research source Alternatively, email the Prime Minister’s Office at: connect@mygov.nic.in . Fax the Prime Minister’s Office at: +91-11-23019545, 23016857.

steps.title: Write to Narendra Modi through his official website.
steps.content: Write to Narendra Modi through his official website. Modi has 2 options available on his official website for writing to him. You can either share ideas or thoughts with him or write a letter of grievance. Choose the option that best suits you and write your concerns in the space allotted. If you are submitting a grievance for the first time, make an account and follow the instructions in the PMO Grievance Portal. Try to focus on the facts, not on your emotions. These can overshadow the issue you want to report.

steps.title: Alternatively, contact PM Modi through his official app.
steps.content: Alternatively, contact PM Modi through his official app. He has released the Narendra Modi app , which offers news updates and a feature to send direct messages. Send your message, write in the forums, and interact with the Prime Minister. [7] X Research source The app is available for Android and iOS.

steps.title: On Facebook
steps.content: On Facebook While you can’t directly message Prime Minister Modi on Facebook, you can interact with the posts on his page or the official page for the Prime Minister’s Office. Leave comments on his frequent posts and videos to interact with him and the community: [8] X Research source Narendra Modi’s Facebook page Prime Minister’s Office Facebook page

steps.title: On X (Formerly Known as Twitter)
steps.content: On X (Formerly Known as Twitter) Prime Minister Modi is active on X throughout the day and is known to respond to some of the posts he receives. Follow his account to stay updated and interact with him: PM Modi’s personal X account Prime Minister’s Office X account
